Award.AwardTitle: An Investigation of Best Practices and Lessons Learned from LSAMP Bride-to-the-Doctorate Programs

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration: Recent statistics show that very few US citizens pursue graduate studies in STEM fields. Of the US citizens that chose to pursue graduate studies in STEM fields a small percentage of these students are from historically underrepresented groups. Of those that chose to pursue graduate studies in STEM fields, there are many factors that enhance or inhibit successful matriculation through the graduate school process. Thus, researchers from the Center for Advancing Faculty Excellence(CAFE'), Florida A&M University, and Prairie View A&M University will work closely with LSAMP BD Program Sites to perform a descriptive research investigation aimed at identifying best practices and lessons learned strategies that can be employed within STEM graduate programs to broaden participation while ensuring student success. As a result of successfully completing this descriptive research investigation, a blueprint for designing and implementing various practices, procedures, and policies proven to ensure the success of broadening participation in STEM graduate education programs will be created. The creation of this blueprint describing best practices and lessons learned will allow valuable information to be shared among STEM graduate program faculty, staff, students, administrators, and other key stakeholders. It is envisioned that this resulting blueprint will become the conduit by which graduate programs can successfully produce the talent needed to fuel the STEM workforce of the future. Hence, this blueprint will serve as a valuable resource to the national STEM community.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Researchers from the Center for Advancing Faculty Excellence (CAFE), Florida A&M University, and Prairie View A&M University were actively working with LSAMP BD Program Sites to perform a descriptive research investigation aimed at identifying best practices and lessons learned strategies that can be employed within STEM graduate programs to broaden participation while ensuring student success. Also, this project team evaluated HBCU sites to develop lessons learned information and characterize institutional best practices of these universities.

This team of researchers worked with the LSAMP BD Program Sites to produce research findings that delineated which practices, procedures, and policies are most effective in ensuring that students successfully complete their graduate degrees. Specifically, during these first two years, the research team developed and administered surveys that collected information on key practices used with BD students. These surveys found an effectiveness and efficacy in mentoring programs, professional development practices, and research development activities.

During the first two years of this project period, professional development workshops and training seminars for both Students and faculty were offered at various LSAMP BD Sites such as The University of South Florida, Florida International University, North Carolina A&T University, Texas A&M University, Prairie View A&M University, Purdue University, Morgan State University, Norfolk State University, Tennessee State University, and Jackson State University.  This project team also worked with THE LSAMP Program to offer a Professional Development Institute in DC for BD students and Alumni with approximately 200 attendees. The seminar/workshops and panel discussions encompassed various subject areas such as advancing research efforts, dealing with difficulties in graduate school, successfully navigating the job search, and handling problems with advisors 

The results of the research project have been shared at the American Society of Engineering Education National Conference Meeting, the National Science Foundation national video showcase, the RAMP (Research Association of Minority Professors), the ERN (Emerging Researchers National) national conference, the ASEE (American Society for Engineering Education) national conference, and the LSAMP 25th National Celebration.
